column4: hi, I just installed ubuntu but it won't recognize my wireless
What card do you have?
Do you know how to pastebin?
That's ok.  paste.ubuntu.com   You go there copy / paste text into it, hit submit, then give me the link so I can see it.  Get it?
That's a start. I need you to pastebin the output of a command.  Can you do that?
Yeah.  the command:  sudo lspci -k    put the output in pastebin (it will be long)
Hit submit, give me the link it goes to  (it's now different than paste.ubuntu.com/
That's it.  reading...
You have a BCM4311 chipset.  It's the last thing in that pastebin.  Do you see it?
I am very confident I can get wireless working with this chipset.  Are you online using the wired interface?
run this command.  sudo apt-get install firwmare-b43-installer    It installs software that runs on the actual wifi card.
It is proprietary software so Ubuntu does not like to distribute it with Ubuntu.  They do provide an easy way (this command) to install it.
You don't have to disconnect wireless.  It isn't working yet.  We have to turn on the module (modules are drivers in linux)  sudo modprobe b43
You have a BCM43xx so we use the b43 module
In unix (and linux) 'no news is good news'  That means there were no errors.
Look in the applet in the panel and see if wireless networks are listed.  If not we need to do one more thing.
You're doing fine :)
If you are confused about what I'm talking about ask more questions and I will explain.
That icon is the applet.  The bar it is in in the top right is the panel.  The card is now working.
Click a network and connect to it.
fixed
hahaha I'm good.
cya
